name: laravel-documentation
title: Laravel Documentation
description: The ultimate Laravel developer toolkit for Raycast. Search 68+ documentation pages, browse 70+ Artisan commands, copy 30+ code snippets, create new projects, and run artisan commands. Supports 17 Laravel versions from Master to 5.0. Features favorites, recent pages, and Laracasts integration.

commands.name: laravel-docs
commands.title: Search Laravel Docs
commands.description: Search and browse Laravel documentation with favorites, recent pages, and version switching
commands.subtitle: Laravel

commands.name: artisan-commands
commands.title: Artisan Commands
commands.description: Browse and copy all Laravel Artisan commands organized by category
commands.subtitle: Laravel

commands.name: snippets
commands.title: Laravel Snippets
commands.description: Copy common Laravel code snippets for routes, models, migrations, and more
commands.subtitle: Laravel

commands.name: create-project
commands.title: Create Laravel Project
commands.description: Create a new Laravel project with starter kit and database options
commands.subtitle: Laravel

commands.name: run-artisan
commands.title: Run Artisan Command
commands.description: Execute Artisan commands in your Laravel project directory
commands.subtitle: Laravel

preferences.name: laravelVersion
preferences.title: Laravel Version
preferences.description: Choose which Laravel version's documentation to browse. Defaults to the latest stable release.

preferences.name: openInNewTab
preferences.title: Browser Behavior
preferences.label: Always open in new tab
preferences.description: When enabled, documentation opens in a new browser tab. When disabled, copies URL to clipboard.

preferences.name: projectDirectory
preferences.title: Laravel Project Directory
preferences.description: Path to your Laravel project for running Artisan commands (e.g., ~/Projects/my-app)

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1

author: jasper_huppertz
